biography.value:
When sorrow distresses eladrin, they enter the winter season, becoming figures of melancholy. Frozen tears drop from their cheeks, and their palpable sadness emanates from them as icy cold.

Eladrin

Eladrin dwell in the verdant splendor of the Feywild. They are related to the elves found on the Material Plane. But while other elves can temper their wild impulses, eladrin are ruled by emotion—and due to their magical nature, they undergo physical changes to match their changes in temperament. Eladrin have spent centuries in the Feywild, and most of them have become Fey creatures as a result—those presented here are of the Fey variety. Some are still Humanoid, however, similar in that respect to their other elven kin. The magic flowing through eladrin responds to their emotional state by transforming them into different seasonal aspects, with behaviors and abilities that change with their forms. Some eladrin might remain in a particular aspect for years, while others run through the emotional spectrum each week.

Changeable Natures

Whenever one of the eladrin presented here finishes a long rest, they can associate themself with a different season, provided they aren’t incapacitated. When the eladrin makes this change, they use the stat block of the new season rather than their old stat block. Any damage the eladrin sustained in their previous form applies to the new form, as do any conditions or other ongoing effects affecting them.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The eladrin makes two Longsword or Longbow attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d8 type=slashing average=true]] damage, or [[/damage 1d10 type=slashing average=true]] damage if used with two hands, plus [[/damage 3d8 type=cold average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d8 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 3d8 type=cold average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The eladrin casts one of the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components and using &Reference[int]{Intelligence} as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):

At will: fog cloud, gust of wind, sleet storm

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Magic Resistance. The eladrin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Sorrowful Presence. Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the eladrin must make a [[/save wis 13 format=long]]. On a failed save, the creature becomes &Reference[charmed]{charmed} by the eladrin for 1 minute. While &Reference[charmed]{charmed} in this way, the creature has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws. The &Reference[charmed]{charmed} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to any eladrin’s Sorrowful Presence for the next 24 hours.

Whenever the eladrin deals damage to the &Reference[charmed]{charmed} creature, the &Reference[charmed]{charmed} creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
When the eladrin takes damage from a creature the eladrin can see within 60 feet of it, the eladrin can &Reference[force]{force} that creature to succeed on a [[/save con 16 format=long]] or take [[/damage 2d10 type=cold average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The eladrin teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
You create a 20-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} of fog centered on a point within range. The &Reference[sphere]{sphere} spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the radius of the fog increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 1st.

A &Reference[line]{line} of strong wind 60 feet long and 10 feet wide blasts from you in a direction you choose for the spell's duration. Each creature that starts its turn in the &Reference[line]{line} must succeed on a &Reference[str]{Strength} saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you in a direction following the &Reference[line]{line}.

Any creature in the &Reference[line]{line} must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving closer to you.

The gust disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a 50 percent chance to extinguish them.

As a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends, you can change the direction in which the &Reference[line]{line} blasts from you.

Until the spell ends, freezing rain and sleet fall in a 20-foot-tall &Reference[cylinder]{cylinder} with a 40-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range. The area is heavily obscured, and exposed flames in the area are doused.

The ground in the area is covered with slick ice, making it difficult terrain. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. On a failed save, it falls &Reference[prone]{prone}.

If a creature starts its turn in the spell's area and is concentrating on a spell, the creature must make a successful &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw against your spell save DC or lose &Reference[concentration]{concentration}.
